article.title: The VIMOS Ultra-Deep Survey: evidence for AGN feedback in galaxies with CIII]-$λ$1908Å emission 10.8 to 12.5 Gyr ago

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements is **incorrect** about the spectra of very strong CIII] emitters (EW(CIII]) ≥ 20Å) shown in Figure 1?
choices: The spectra exhibit a variety of properties, with some showing strong Ly-a emission while others show weak or absent Ly-a emission.
The presence of CIV-11549 emission indicates a substantial flux of ionizing photons with energies in excess of 47.9 eV.
All spectra clearly show strong Ly-a emission, indicating a strong correlation between CIII] and Ly-a emission.
The spectra showcase a diverse range of emission lines besides CIII], including HeII-1640 and NV-11240.

multiple_choice_question.text: What trend is observed in the composite spectra of CIII]-11908 emitters as EW(CIII]) increases, as shown in Figure 4?
choices: The UV continuum slope becomes steeper.
The intensity of emission lines requiring higher ionization potentials decreases.
The Lya emission consistently shifts to lower wavelengths.
The HeII-11640 emission line becomes progressively stronger.

multiple_choice_question.text: What conclusion can be drawn from Figure 7 regarding the relationship between EW(CIII]) and EW(Lya)?
choices: There is a perfect one-to-one correlation between EW(CIII]) and EW(Lya).
Galaxies with strong Lya emission always have strong CIII] emission.
There is a trend for stronger CIII] emitters to also have stronger Lya emission, but with significant dispersion.
There is no correlation between EW(CIII]) and EW(Lya).

multiple_choice_question.text: How is the location of strong and very strong CIII] emitters (EW(CIII]) > 10Å) in the SFR-Mstar plane different from the general star-forming galaxy population, as shown in Figure 12?
choices: They are located significantly above the main sequence.
They are located significantly below the main sequence.
They show no difference in location compared to the main sequence.
They are predominantly found in regions of low stellar mass.
